00057 static int mgc_name2resid(char *name, int len, struct ldlm_res_id *res_id,
00058                           int type)
00059 {
00060         __u64 resname = 0;
00061 
00062         if (len > sizeof(resname)) {
00063                 CERROR("name too long: %s\n", name);
00064                 return -EINVAL;
00065         }
00066         if (len <= 0) {
00067                 CERROR("missing name: %s\n", name);
00068                 return -EINVAL;
00069         }
00070         memcpy(&resname, name, len);
00071 
00072         /* Always use the same endianness for the resid */
00073         memset(res_id, 0, sizeof(*res_id));
00074         res_id->name[0] = cpu_to_le64(resname);
00075         /* XXX: unfortunately, sptlprc and config llog share one lock */
00076         switch(type) {
00077         case CONFIG_T_CONFIG:
00078         case CONFIG_T_SPTLRPC:
00079                 resname = 0;
00080                 break;
00081         case CONFIG_T_RECOVER:
00082         case CONFIG_T_PARAMS:
00083                 resname = type;
00084                 break;
00085         default:
00086                 LBUG();
00087         }
00088         res_id->name[1] = cpu_to_le64(resname);
00089         CDEBUG(D_MGC, "log %s to resid "LPX64"/"LPX64" (%.8s)\n", name,
00090                res_id->name[0], res_id->name[1], (char *)&res_id->name[0]);
00091         return 0;
00092 }
00093 
00094 int mgc_fsname2resid(char *fsname, struct ldlm_res_id *res_id, int type)
00095 {
00096         /* fsname is at most 8 chars long, maybe contain "-".
00097          * e.g. "lustre", "SUN-000" */
00098         return mgc_name2resid(fsname, strlen(fsname), res_id, type);
00099 }
00100 EXPORT_SYMBOL(mgc_fsname2resid);
00101 
00102 static int mgc_logname2resid(char *logname, struct ldlm_res_id *res_id,
00103                              int type)
00104 {
00105         char *name_end;
00106         int len;
00107 
00108         /* logname consists of "fsname-nodetype".
00109          * e.g. "lustre-MDT0001", "SUN-000-client"
00110          * there is an exception: llog "params" */
00111         name_end = strrchr(logname, '-');
00112         if (!name_end)
00113                 len = strlen(logname);
00114         else
00115                 len = name_end - logname;
00116         return mgc_name2resid(logname, len, res_id, type);
00117 }
00118 
00119 /********************** config llog list **********************/
00120 static struct list_head config_llog_list = LIST_HEAD_INIT(config_llog_list);
00121 static DEFINE_SPINLOCK(config_list_lock);
00122 
00123 /* Take a reference to a config log */
00124 static int config_log_get(struct config_llog_data *cld)
00125 {
00126         ENTRY;
00127         atomic_inc(&cld->cld_refcount);
00128         CDEBUG(D_INFO, "log %s refs %d\n", cld->cld_logname,
00129                 atomic_read(&cld->cld_refcount));
00130         RETURN(0);
00131 }
00132 
00133 /* Drop a reference to a config log.  When no longer referenced,
00134    we can free the config log data */
00135 static void config_log_put(struct config_llog_data *cld)
00136 {
00137         ENTRY;
00138 
00139         CDEBUG(D_INFO, "log %s refs %d\n", cld->cld_logname,
00140                 atomic_read(&cld->cld_refcount));
00141         LASSERT(atomic_read(&cld->cld_refcount) > 0);
00142 
00143         /* spinlock to make sure no item with 0 refcount in the list */
00144         if (atomic_dec_and_lock(&cld->cld_refcount, &config_list_lock)) {
00145                 list_del(&cld->cld_list_chain);
00146                 spin_unlock(&config_list_lock);
00147 
00148                 CDEBUG(D_MGC, "dropping config log %s\n", cld->cld_logname);
00149 
00150                 if (cld->cld_recover)
00151                         config_log_put(cld->cld_recover);
00152                 if (cld->cld_sptlrpc)
00153                         config_log_put(cld->cld_sptlrpc);
00154                 if (cld->cld_params)
00155                         config_log_put(cld->cld_params);
00156                 if (cld_is_sptlrpc(cld))
00157                         sptlrpc_conf_log_stop(cld->cld_logname);
00158 
00159                 class_export_put(cld->cld_mgcexp);
00160                 OBD_FREE(cld, sizeof(*cld) + strlen(cld->cld_logname) + 1);
00161         }
00162 
00163         EXIT;
00164 }
00165 
00166 /* Find a config log by name */
00167 static
00168 struct config_llog_data *config_log_find(char *logname,
00169                                          struct config_llog_instance *cfg)
00170 {
00171         struct config_llog_data *cld;
00172         struct config_llog_data *found = NULL;
00173         void *                   instance;
00174         ENTRY;
00175 
00176         LASSERT(logname != NULL);
00177 
00178         instance = cfg ? cfg->cfg_instance : NULL;
00179         spin_lock(&config_list_lock);
00180         list_for_each_entry(cld, &config_llog_list, cld_list_chain) {
00181                 /* check if instance equals */
00182                 if (instance != cld->cld_cfg.cfg_instance)
00183                         continue;
00184 
00185                 /* instance may be NULL, should check name */
00186                 if (strcmp(logname, cld->cld_logname) == 0) {
00187                         found = cld;
00188                         break;
00189                 }
00190         }
00191         if (found) {
00192                 atomic_inc(&found->cld_refcount);
00193                 LASSERT(found->cld_stopping == 0 || cld_is_sptlrpc(found) == 0);
00194         }
00195         spin_unlock(&config_list_lock);
00196         RETURN(found);
00197 }
00198 
00199 static
00200 struct config_llog_data *do_config_log_add(struct obd_device *obd,
00201                                            char *logname,
00202                                            int type,
00203                                            struct config_llog_instance *cfg,
00204                                            struct super_block *sb)
00205 {
00206         struct config_llog_data *cld;
00207         int                      rc;
00208         ENTRY;
00209 
00210         CDEBUG(D_MGC, "do adding config log %s:%p\n", logname,
00211                cfg ? cfg->cfg_instance : NULL);
00212 
00213         OBD_ALLOC(cld, sizeof(*cld) + strlen(logname) + 1);
00214         if (!cld)
00215                 RETURN(ERR_PTR(-ENOMEM));
00216 
00217         strcpy(cld->cld_logname, logname);
00218         if (cfg)
00219                 cld->cld_cfg = *cfg;
00220         else
00221                 cld->cld_cfg.cfg_callback = class_config_llog_handler;
00222         mutex_init(&cld->cld_lock);
00223         cld->cld_cfg.cfg_last_idx = 0;
00224         cld->cld_cfg.cfg_flags = 0;
00225         cld->cld_cfg.cfg_sb = sb;
00226         cld->cld_type = type;
00227         atomic_set(&cld->cld_refcount, 1);
00228 
00229         /* Keep the mgc around until we are done */
00230         cld->cld_mgcexp = class_export_get(obd->obd_self_export);
00231 
00232         if (cld_is_sptlrpc(cld)) {
00233                 sptlrpc_conf_log_start(logname);
00234                 cld->cld_cfg.cfg_obdname = obd->obd_name;
00235         }
00236 
00237         rc = mgc_logname2resid(logname, &cld->cld_resid, type);
00238 
00239         spin_lock(&config_list_lock);
00240         list_add(&cld->cld_list_chain, &config_llog_list);
00241         spin_unlock(&config_list_lock);
00242 
00243         if (rc) {
00244                 config_log_put(cld);
00245                 RETURN(ERR_PTR(rc));
00246         }
00247 
00248         if (cld_is_sptlrpc(cld)) {
00249                 rc = mgc_process_log(obd, cld);
00250                 if (rc && rc != -ENOENT)
00251                         CERROR("failed processing sptlrpc log: %d\n", rc);
00252         }
00253 
00254         RETURN(cld);
00255 }
00256 
00257 static struct config_llog_data *config_recover_log_add(struct obd_device *obd,
00258         char *fsname,
00259         struct config_llog_instance *cfg,
00260         struct super_block *sb)
00261 {
00262         struct config_llog_instance lcfg = *cfg;
00263         struct lustre_sb_info *lsi = s2lsi(sb);
00264         struct config_llog_data *cld;
00265         char logname[32];
00266 
00267         if (IS_OST(lsi))
00268                 return NULL;
00269 
00270         /* for osp-on-ost, see lustre_start_osp() */
00271         if (IS_MDT(lsi) && lcfg.cfg_instance)
00272                 return NULL;
00273 
00274         /* we have to use different llog for clients and mdts for cmd
00275          * where only clients are notified if one of cmd server restarts */
00276         LASSERT(strlen(fsname) < sizeof(logname) / 2);
00277         strcpy(logname, fsname);
00278         if (IS_SERVER(lsi)) { /* mdt */
00279                 LASSERT(lcfg.cfg_instance == NULL);
00280                 lcfg.cfg_instance = sb;
00281                 strcat(logname, "-mdtir");
00282         } else {
00283                 LASSERT(lcfg.cfg_instance != NULL);
00284                 strcat(logname, "-cliir");
00285         }
00286 
00287         cld = do_config_log_add(obd, logname, CONFIG_T_RECOVER, &lcfg, sb);
00288         return cld;
00289 }
00290 
00291 static struct config_llog_data *config_params_log_add(struct obd_device *obd,
00292         struct config_llog_instance *cfg, struct super_block *sb)
00293 {
00294         struct config_llog_instance     lcfg = *cfg;
00295         struct config_llog_data         *cld;
00296 
00297         lcfg.cfg_instance = sb;
00298 
00299         cld = do_config_log_add(obd, PARAMS_FILENAME, CONFIG_T_PARAMS,
00300                                 &lcfg, sb);
00301 
00302         return cld;
00303 }
00304 
00310 static int config_log_add(struct obd_device *obd, char *logname,
00311                           struct config_llog_instance *cfg,
00312                           struct super_block *sb)
00313 {
00314         struct lustre_sb_info   *lsi = s2lsi(sb);
00315         struct config_llog_data *cld;
00316         struct config_llog_data *sptlrpc_cld;
00317         struct config_llog_data *params_cld;
00318         char                    seclogname[32];
00319         char                    *ptr;
00320         int                     rc;
00321         ENTRY;
00322 
00323         CDEBUG(D_MGC, "adding config log %s:%p\n", logname, cfg->cfg_instance);
00324 
00325         /*
00326          * for each regular log, the depended sptlrpc log name is
00327          * <fsname>-sptlrpc. multiple regular logs may share one sptlrpc log.
00328          */
00329         ptr = strrchr(logname, '-');
00330         if (ptr == NULL || ptr - logname > 8) {
00331                 CERROR("logname %s is too long\n", logname);
00332                 RETURN(-EINVAL);
00333         }
00334 
00335         memcpy(seclogname, logname, ptr - logname);
00336         strcpy(seclogname + (ptr - logname), "-sptlrpc");
00337 
00338         sptlrpc_cld = config_log_find(seclogname, NULL);
00339         if (sptlrpc_cld == NULL) {
00340                 sptlrpc_cld = do_config_log_add(obd, seclogname,
00341                                                 CONFIG_T_SPTLRPC, NULL, NULL);
00342                 if (IS_ERR(sptlrpc_cld)) {
00343                         CERROR("can't create sptlrpc log: %s\n", seclogname);
00344                         GOTO(out_err, rc = PTR_ERR(sptlrpc_cld));
00345                 }
00346         }
00347         params_cld = config_params_log_add(obd, cfg, sb);
00348         if (IS_ERR(params_cld)) {
00349                 rc = PTR_ERR(params_cld);
00350                 CERROR("%s: can't create params log: rc = %d\n",
00351                        obd->obd_name, rc);
00352                 GOTO(out_err1, rc);
00353         }
00354 
00355         cld = do_config_log_add(obd, logname, CONFIG_T_CONFIG, cfg, sb);
00356         if (IS_ERR(cld)) {
00357                 CERROR("can't create log: %s\n", logname);
00358                 GOTO(out_err2, rc = PTR_ERR(cld));
00359         }
00360 
00361         cld->cld_sptlrpc = sptlrpc_cld;
00362         cld->cld_params = params_cld;
00363 
00364         LASSERT(lsi->lsi_lmd);
00365         if (!(lsi->lsi_lmd->lmd_flags & LMD_FLG_NOIR)) {
00366                 struct config_llog_data *recover_cld;
00367                 ptr = strrchr(seclogname, '-');
00368                 if (ptr != NULL) {
00369                         *ptr = 0;
00370                 }
00371                 else {
00372                         CERROR("%s: sptlrpc log name not correct, %s: "
00373                                "rc = %d\n", obd->obd_name, seclogname, -EINVAL);
00374                         config_log_put(cld);
00375                         RETURN(-EINVAL);
00376                 }
00377                 recover_cld = config_recover_log_add(obd, seclogname, cfg, sb);
00378                 if (IS_ERR(recover_cld))
00379                         GOTO(out_err3, rc = PTR_ERR(recover_cld));
00380                 cld->cld_recover = recover_cld;
00381         }
00382 
00383         RETURN(0);
00384 
00385 out_err3:
00386         config_log_put(cld);
00387 
00388 out_err2:
00389         config_log_put(params_cld);
00390 
00391 out_err1:
00392         config_log_put(sptlrpc_cld);
00393 
00394 out_err:
00395         RETURN(rc);
00396 }
00397 
00398 DEFINE_MUTEX(llog_process_lock);
00399 
00402 static int config_log_end(char *logname, struct config_llog_instance *cfg)
00403 {
00404         struct config_llog_data *cld;
00405         struct config_llog_data *cld_sptlrpc = NULL;
00406         struct config_llog_data *cld_params = NULL;
00407         struct config_llog_data *cld_recover = NULL;
00408         int rc = 0;
00409         ENTRY;
00410 
00411         cld = config_log_find(logname, cfg);
00412         if (cld == NULL)
00413                 RETURN(-ENOENT);
00414 
00415         mutex_lock(&cld->cld_lock);
00416         /*
00417          * if cld_stopping is set, it means we didn't start the log thus
00418          * not owning the start ref. this can happen after previous umount:
00419          * the cld still hanging there waiting for lock cancel, and we
00420          * remount again but failed in the middle and call log_end without
00421          * calling start_log.
00422          */
00423         if (unlikely(cld->cld_stopping)) {
00424                 mutex_unlock(&cld->cld_lock);
00425                 /* drop the ref from the find */
00426                 config_log_put(cld);
00427                 RETURN(rc);
00428         }
00429 
00430         cld->cld_stopping = 1;
00431 
00432         cld_recover = cld->cld_recover;
00433         cld->cld_recover = NULL;
00434         mutex_unlock(&cld->cld_lock);
00435 
00436         if (cld_recover) {
00437                 mutex_lock(&cld_recover->cld_lock);
00438                 cld_recover->cld_stopping = 1;
00439                 mutex_unlock(&cld_recover->cld_lock);
00440                 config_log_put(cld_recover);
00441         }
00442 
00443         spin_lock(&config_list_lock);
00444         cld_sptlrpc = cld->cld_sptlrpc;
00445         cld->cld_sptlrpc = NULL;
00446         cld_params = cld->cld_params;
00447         cld->cld_params = NULL;
00448         spin_unlock(&config_list_lock);
00449 
00450         if (cld_sptlrpc)
00451                 config_log_put(cld_sptlrpc);
00452 
00453         if (cld_params) {
00454                 mutex_lock(&cld_params->cld_lock);
00455                 cld_params->cld_stopping = 1;
00456                 mutex_unlock(&cld_params->cld_lock);
00457                 config_log_put(cld_params);
00458         }
00459 
00460         /* drop the ref from the find */
00461         config_log_put(cld);
00462         /* drop the start ref */
00463         config_log_put(cld);
00464 
00465         CDEBUG(D_MGC, "end config log %s (%d)\n", logname ? logname : "client",
00466                rc);
00467         RETURN(rc);
00468 }
00469 
00470 #ifdef CONFIG_PROC_FS
00471 int lprocfs_mgc_rd_ir_state(struct seq_file *m, void *data)
00472 {
00473         struct obd_device       *obd = data;
00474         struct obd_import       *imp;
00475         struct obd_connect_data *ocd;
00476         struct config_llog_data *cld;
00477         ENTRY;
00478 
00479         LASSERT(obd != NULL);
00480         LPROCFS_CLIMP_CHECK(obd);
00481         imp = obd->u.cli.cl_import;
00482         ocd = &imp->imp_connect_data;
00483 
00484         seq_printf(m, "imperative_recovery: %s\n",
00485                    OCD_HAS_FLAG(ocd, IMP_RECOV) ? "ENABLED" : "DISABLED");
00486         seq_printf(m, "client_state:\n");
00487 
00488         spin_lock(&config_list_lock);
00489         list_for_each_entry(cld, &config_llog_list, cld_list_chain) {
00490                 if (cld->cld_recover == NULL)
00491                         continue;
00492                 seq_printf(m,  "    - { client: %s, nidtbl_version: %u }\n",
00493                            cld->cld_logname,
00494                            cld->cld_recover->cld_cfg.cfg_last_idx);
00495         }
00496         spin_unlock(&config_list_lock);
00497 
00498         LPROCFS_CLIMP_EXIT(obd);
00499         RETURN(0);
00500 }
00501 #endif
00502 
00503 /* reenqueue any lost locks */
00504 #define RQ_RUNNING      0x1
00505 #define RQ_NOW          0x2
00506 #define RQ_LATER        0x4
00507 #define RQ_STOP         0x8
00508 #define RQ_PRECLEANUP   0x10
00509 static int                    rq_state = 0;
00510 static wait_queue_head_t      rq_waitq;
00511 static DECLARE_COMPLETION(rq_exit);
00512 static DECLARE_COMPLETION(rq_start);
00513 
00514 static void do_requeue(struct config_llog_data *cld)
00515 {
00516         int rc = 0;
00517         ENTRY;
00518 
00519         LASSERT(atomic_read(&cld->cld_refcount) > 0);
00520 
00521         /* Do not run mgc_process_log on a disconnected export or an
00522          * export which is being disconnected. Take the client
00523          * semaphore to make the check non-racy. */
00524         down_read(&cld->cld_mgcexp->exp_obd->u.cli.cl_sem);
00525         if (cld->cld_mgcexp->exp_obd->u.cli.cl_conn_count != 0) {
00526                 CDEBUG(D_MGC, "updating log %s\n", cld->cld_logname);
00527                 rc = mgc_process_log(cld->cld_mgcexp->exp_obd, cld);
00528                 if (rc && rc != -ENOENT)
00529                         CERROR("failed processing log: %d\n", rc);
00530         } else {
00531                 CDEBUG(D_MGC, "disconnecting, won't update log %s\n",
00532                        cld->cld_logname);
00533         }
00534         up_read(&cld->cld_mgcexp->exp_obd->u.cli.cl_sem);
00535 
00536         EXIT;
00537 }
00538 
00539 /* this timeout represents how many seconds MGC should wait before
00540  * requeue config and recover lock to the MGS. We need to randomize this
00541  * in order to not flood the MGS.
00542  */
00543 #define MGC_TIMEOUT_MIN_SECONDS   5
00544 #define MGC_TIMEOUT_RAND_CENTISEC 0x1ff /* ~500 */
00545 
00546 static int mgc_requeue_thread(void *data)
00547 {
00548         int rc = 0;
00549         bool first = true;
00550         ENTRY;
00551 
00552         CDEBUG(D_MGC, "Starting requeue thread\n");
00553 
00554         /* Keep trying failed locks periodically */
00555         spin_lock(&config_list_lock);
00556         rq_state |= RQ_RUNNING;
00557         while (1) {
00558                 struct l_wait_info lwi;
00559                 struct config_llog_data *cld, *cld_prev;
00560                 int rand = cfs_rand() & MGC_TIMEOUT_RAND_CENTISEC;
00561                 int stopped = !!(rq_state & RQ_STOP);
00562                 int to;
00563 
00564                 /* Any new or requeued lostlocks will change the state */
00565                 rq_state &= ~(RQ_NOW | RQ_LATER);
00566                 spin_unlock(&config_list_lock);
00567 
00568                 if (first) {
00569                         first = false;
00570                         complete(&rq_start);
00571                 }
00572 
00573                 /* Always wait a few seconds to allow the server who
00574                    caused the lock revocation to finish its setup, plus some
00575                    random so everyone doesn't try to reconnect at once. */
00576                 to = msecs_to_jiffies(MGC_TIMEOUT_MIN_SECONDS * MSEC_PER_SEC);
00577                 /* rand is centi-seconds */
00578                 to += msecs_to_jiffies(rand * MSEC_PER_SEC / 100);
00579                 lwi = LWI_TIMEOUT(to, NULL, NULL);
00580                 l_wait_event(rq_waitq, rq_state & (RQ_STOP | RQ_PRECLEANUP),
00581                              &lwi);
00582 
00583                 /*
00584                  * iterate & processing through the list. for each cld, process
00585                  * its depending sptlrpc cld firstly (if any) and then itself.
00586                  *
00587                  * it's guaranteed any item in the list must have
00588                  * reference > 0; and if cld_lostlock is set, at
00589                  * least one reference is taken by the previous enqueue.
00590                  */
00591                 cld_prev = NULL;
00592 
00593                 spin_lock(&config_list_lock);
00594                 rq_state &= ~RQ_PRECLEANUP;
00595                 list_for_each_entry(cld, &config_llog_list,
00596                                         cld_list_chain) {
00597                         if (!cld->cld_lostlock)
00598                                 continue;
00599 
00600                         spin_unlock(&config_list_lock);
00601 
00602                         LASSERT(atomic_read(&cld->cld_refcount) > 0);
00603 
00604                         /* Whether we enqueued again or not in mgc_process_log,
00605                          * we're done with the ref from the old enqueue */
00606                         if (cld_prev)
00607                                 config_log_put(cld_prev);
00608                         cld_prev = cld;
00609 
00610                         cld->cld_lostlock = 0;
00611                         if (likely(!stopped))
00612                                 do_requeue(cld);
00613 
00614                         spin_lock(&config_list_lock);
00615                 }
00616                 spin_unlock(&config_list_lock);
00617                 if (cld_prev)
00618                         config_log_put(cld_prev);
00619 
00620                 /* break after scanning the list so that we can drop
00621                  * refcount to losing lock clds */
00622                 if (unlikely(stopped)) {
00623                         spin_lock(&config_list_lock);
00624                         break;
00625                 }
00626 
00627                 /* Wait a bit to see if anyone else needs a requeue */
00628                 lwi = (struct l_wait_info) { 0 };
00629                 l_wait_event(rq_waitq, rq_state & (RQ_NOW | RQ_STOP),
00630                              &lwi);
00631                 spin_lock(&config_list_lock);
00632         }
00633         /* spinlock and while guarantee RQ_NOW and RQ_LATER are not set */
00634         rq_state &= ~RQ_RUNNING;
00635         spin_unlock(&config_list_lock);
00636 
00637         complete(&rq_exit);
00638 
00639         CDEBUG(D_MGC, "Ending requeue thread\n");
00640         RETURN(rc);
00641 }
00642 
00643 /* Add a cld to the list to requeue.  Start the requeue thread if needed.
00644    We are responsible for dropping the config log reference from here on out. */
00645 static void mgc_requeue_add(struct config_llog_data *cld)
00646 {
00647         ENTRY;
00648 
00649         CDEBUG(D_INFO, "log %s: requeue (r=%d sp=%d st=%x)\n",
00650                 cld->cld_logname, atomic_read(&cld->cld_refcount),
00651                 cld->cld_stopping, rq_state);
00652         LASSERT(atomic_read(&cld->cld_refcount) > 0);
00653 
00654         mutex_lock(&cld->cld_lock);
00655         if (cld->cld_stopping || cld->cld_lostlock) {
00656                 mutex_unlock(&cld->cld_lock);
00657                 RETURN_EXIT;
00658         }
00659         /* this refcount will be released in mgc_requeue_thread. */
00660         config_log_get(cld);
00661         cld->cld_lostlock = 1;
00662         mutex_unlock(&cld->cld_lock);
00663 
00664         /* Hold lock for rq_state */
00665         spin_lock(&config_list_lock);
00666         if (rq_state & RQ_STOP) {
00667                 spin_unlock(&config_list_lock);
00668                 cld->cld_lostlock = 0;
00669                 config_log_put(cld);
00670         } else {
00671                 rq_state |= RQ_NOW;
00672                 spin_unlock(&config_list_lock);
00673                 wake_up(&rq_waitq);
00674         }
00675         EXIT;
00676 }
00677 
00678 /********************** class fns **********************/
00679 static int mgc_local_llog_init(const struct lu_env *env,
00680                                struct obd_device *obd,
00681                                struct obd_device *disk)
00682 {
00683         struct llog_ctxt        *ctxt;
00684         int                      rc;
00685 
00686         ENTRY;
00687 
00688         rc = llog_setup(env, obd, &obd->obd_olg, LLOG_CONFIG_ORIG_CTXT, disk,
00689                         &llog_osd_ops);
00690         if (rc)
00691                 RETURN(rc);
00692 
00693         ctxt = llog_get_context(obd, LLOG_CONFIG_ORIG_CTXT);
00694         LASSERT(ctxt);
00695         ctxt->loc_dir = obd->u.cli.cl_mgc_configs_dir;
00696         llog_ctxt_put(ctxt);
00697 
00698         RETURN(0);
00699 }
00700 
00701 static int mgc_local_llog_fini(const struct lu_env *env,
00702                                struct obd_device *obd)
00703 {
00704         struct llog_ctxt *ctxt;
00705 
00706         ENTRY;
00707 
00708         ctxt = llog_get_context(obd, LLOG_CONFIG_ORIG_CTXT);
00709         llog_cleanup(env, ctxt);
00710 
00711         RETURN(0);
00712 }
00713 
00714 static int mgc_fs_setup(const struct lu_env *env, struct obd_device *obd,
00715                         struct super_block *sb)
00716 {
00717         struct lustre_sb_info   *lsi = s2lsi(sb);
00718         struct client_obd       *cli = &obd->u.cli;
00719         struct lu_fid            rfid, fid;
00720         struct dt_object        *root, *dto;
00721         int                      rc = 0;
00722 
00723         ENTRY;
00724 
00725         LASSERT(lsi);
00726         LASSERT(lsi->lsi_dt_dev);
00727 
00728         /* The mgc fs exclusion mutex. Only one fs can be setup at a time. */
00729         mutex_lock(&cli->cl_mgc_mutex);
00730 
00731         /* Setup the configs dir */
00732         fid.f_seq = FID_SEQ_LOCAL_NAME;
00733         fid.f_oid = 1;
00734         fid.f_ver = 0;
00735         rc = local_oid_storage_init(env, lsi->lsi_dt_dev, &fid,
00736                                     &cli->cl_mgc_los);
00737         if (rc)
00738                 RETURN(rc);
00739 
00740         rc = dt_root_get(env, lsi->lsi_dt_dev, &rfid);
00741         if (rc)
00742                 GOTO(out_los, rc);
00743 
00744         root = dt_locate_at(env, lsi->lsi_dt_dev, &rfid,
00745                             &cli->cl_mgc_los->los_dev->dd_lu_dev, NULL);
00746         if (unlikely(IS_ERR(root)))
00747                 GOTO(out_los, rc = PTR_ERR(root));
00748 
00749         dto = local_file_find_or_create(env, cli->cl_mgc_los, root,
00750                                         MOUNT_CONFIGS_DIR,
00751                                         S_IFDIR | S_IRUGO | S_IWUSR | S_IXUGO);
00752         lu_object_put_nocache(env, &root->do_lu);
00753         if (IS_ERR(dto))
00754                 GOTO(out_los, rc = PTR_ERR(dto));
00755 
00756         cli->cl_mgc_configs_dir = dto;
00757 
00758         LASSERT(lsi->lsi_osd_exp->exp_obd->obd_lvfs_ctxt.dt);
00759         rc = mgc_local_llog_init(env, obd, lsi->lsi_osd_exp->exp_obd);
00760         if (rc)
00761                 GOTO(out_llog, rc);
00762 
00763         /* We take an obd ref to insure that we can't get to mgc_cleanup
00764          * without calling mgc_fs_cleanup first. */
00765         class_incref(obd, "mgc_fs", obd);
00766 
00767         /* We keep the cl_mgc_sem until mgc_fs_cleanup */
00768         EXIT;
00769 out_llog:
00770         if (rc) {
00771                 lu_object_put(env, &cli->cl_mgc_configs_dir->do_lu);
00772                 cli->cl_mgc_configs_dir = NULL;
00773         }
00774 out_los:
00775         if (rc < 0) {
00776                 local_oid_storage_fini(env, cli->cl_mgc_los);
00777                 cli->cl_mgc_los = NULL;
00778                 mutex_unlock(&cli->cl_mgc_mutex);
00779         }
00780         return rc;
00781 }
00782 
00783 static int mgc_fs_cleanup(const struct lu_env *env, struct obd_device *obd)
00784 {
00785         struct client_obd       *cli = &obd->u.cli;
00786         ENTRY;
00787 
00788         LASSERT(cli->cl_mgc_los != NULL);
00789 
00790         mgc_local_llog_fini(env, obd);
00791 
00792         lu_object_put_nocache(env, &cli->cl_mgc_configs_dir->do_lu);
00793         cli->cl_mgc_configs_dir = NULL;
00794 
00795         local_oid_storage_fini(env, cli->cl_mgc_los);
00796         cli->cl_mgc_los = NULL;
00797 
00798         class_decref(obd, "mgc_fs", obd);
00799         mutex_unlock(&cli->cl_mgc_mutex);
00800 
00801         RETURN(0);
00802 }
00803 
00804 static int mgc_llog_init(const struct lu_env *env, struct obd_device *obd)
00805 {
00806         struct llog_ctxt        *ctxt;
00807         int                      rc;
00808 
00809         ENTRY;
00810 
00811         /* setup only remote ctxt, the local disk context is switched per each
00812          * filesystem during mgc_fs_setup() */
00813         rc = llog_setup(env, obd, &obd->obd_olg, LLOG_CONFIG_REPL_CTXT, obd,
00814                         &llog_client_ops);
00815         if (rc)
00816                 RETURN(rc);
00817 
00818         ctxt = llog_get_context(obd, LLOG_CONFIG_REPL_CTXT);
00819         LASSERT(ctxt);
00820 
00821         llog_initiator_connect(ctxt);
00822         llog_ctxt_put(ctxt);
00823 
00824         RETURN(0);
00825 }
00826 
00827 static int mgc_llog_fini(const struct lu_env *env, struct obd_device *obd)
00828 {
00829         struct llog_ctxt *ctxt;
00830 
00831         ENTRY;
00832 
00833         ctxt = llog_get_context(obd, LLOG_CONFIG_REPL_CTXT);
00834         if (ctxt)
00835                 llog_cleanup(env, ctxt);
00836 
00837         RETURN(0);
00838 }
00839 
00840 
00841 static atomic_t mgc_count = ATOMIC_INIT(0);
00842 static int mgc_precleanup(struct obd_device *obd)
00843 {
00844         int     rc = 0;
00845         int     temp;
00846         ENTRY;
00847 
00848         if (atomic_dec_and_test(&mgc_count)) {
00849                 LASSERT(rq_state & RQ_RUNNING);
00850                 /* stop requeue thread */
00851                 temp = RQ_STOP;
00852         } else {
00853                 /* wakeup requeue thread to clean our cld */
00854                 temp = RQ_NOW | RQ_PRECLEANUP;
00855         }
00856 
00857         spin_lock(&config_list_lock);
00858         rq_state |= temp;
00859         spin_unlock(&config_list_lock);
00860         wake_up(&rq_waitq);
00861 
00862         if (temp & RQ_STOP)
00863                 wait_for_completion(&rq_exit);
00864         obd_cleanup_client_import(obd);
00865 
00866         rc = mgc_llog_fini(NULL, obd);
00867         if (rc != 0)
00868                 CERROR("failed to cleanup llogging subsystems\n");
00869 
00870         RETURN(rc);
00871 }
00872 
00873 static int mgc_cleanup(struct obd_device *obd)
00874 {
00875         int rc;
00876         ENTRY;
00877 
00878         /* COMPAT_146 - old config logs may have added profiles we don't
00879            know about */
00880         if (obd->obd_type->typ_refcnt <= 1)
00881                 /* Only for the last mgc */
00882                 class_del_profiles();
00883 
00884         lprocfs_obd_cleanup(obd);
00885         ptlrpcd_decref();
00886 
00887         rc = client_obd_cleanup(obd);
00888         RETURN(rc);
00889 }
00890 
00891 static int mgc_setup(struct obd_device *obd, struct lustre_cfg *lcfg)
00892 {
00893         struct task_struct      *task;
00894         int                      rc;
00895         ENTRY;
00896 
00897         rc = ptlrpcd_addref();
00898         if (rc < 0)
00899                 RETURN(rc);
00900 
00901         rc = client_obd_setup(obd, lcfg);
00902         if (rc)
00903                 GOTO(err_decref, rc);
00904 
00905         rc = mgc_llog_init(NULL, obd);
00906         if (rc) {
00907                 CERROR("failed to setup llogging subsystems\n");
00908                 GOTO(err_cleanup, rc);
00909         }
00910 
00911 #ifdef CONFIG_PROC_FS
00912         obd->obd_vars = lprocfs_mgc_obd_vars;
00913         lprocfs_obd_setup(obd);
00914 #endif
00915         sptlrpc_lprocfs_cliobd_attach(obd);
00916 
00917         if (atomic_inc_return(&mgc_count) == 1) {
00918                 rq_state = 0;
00919                 init_waitqueue_head(&rq_waitq);
00920 
00921                 /* start requeue thread */
00922                 task = kthread_run(mgc_requeue_thread, NULL, "ll_cfg_requeue");
00923                 if (IS_ERR(task)) {
00924                         rc = PTR_ERR(task);
00925                         CERROR("%s: cannot start requeue thread: rc = %d; "
00926                                "no more log updates\n",
00927                                obd->obd_name, rc);
00928                         GOTO(err_cleanup, rc);
00929                 }
00930                 /* rc is the task_struct pointer of mgc_requeue_thread. */
00931                 rc = 0;
00932                 wait_for_completion(&rq_start);
00933         }
00934 
00935         RETURN(rc);
00936 
00937 err_cleanup:
00938         client_obd_cleanup(obd);
00939 err_decref:
00940         ptlrpcd_decref();
00941         RETURN(rc);
00942 }
00943 
00944 /* based on ll_mdc_blocking_ast */
00945 static int mgc_blocking_ast(struct ldlm_lock *lock, struct ldlm_lock_desc *desc,
00946                             void *data, int flag)
00947 {
00948         struct lustre_handle lockh;
00949         struct config_llog_data *cld = (struct config_llog_data *)data;
00950         int rc = 0;
00951         ENTRY;
00952 
00953         switch (flag) {
00954         case LDLM_CB_BLOCKING:
00955                 /* mgs wants the lock, give it up... */
00956                 LDLM_DEBUG(lock, "MGC blocking CB");
00957                 ldlm_lock2handle(lock, &lockh);
00958                 rc = ldlm_cli_cancel(&lockh, LCF_ASYNC);
00959                 break;
00960         case LDLM_CB_CANCELING:
00961                 /* We've given up the lock, prepare ourselves to update. */
00962                 LDLM_DEBUG(lock, "MGC cancel CB");
00963 
00964                 CDEBUG(D_MGC, "Lock res "DLDLMRES" (%.8s)\n",
00965                        PLDLMRES(lock->l_resource),
00966                        (char *)&lock->l_resource->lr_name.name[0]);
00967 
00968                 if (!cld) {
00969                         CDEBUG(D_INFO, "missing data, won't requeue\n");
00970                         break;
00971                 }
00972 
00973                 /* held at mgc_process_log(). */
00974                 LASSERT(atomic_read(&cld->cld_refcount) > 0);
00975                 /* Are we done with this log? */
00976                 if (cld->cld_stopping) {
00977                         CDEBUG(D_MGC, "log %s: stopping, won't requeue\n",
00978                                 cld->cld_logname);
00979                         config_log_put(cld);
00980                         break;
00981                 }
00982                 /* Make sure not to re-enqueue when the mgc is stopping
00983                    (we get called from client_disconnect_export) */
00984                 if (lock->l_conn_export == NULL ||
00985                     lock->l_conn_export->exp_obd->u.cli.cl_conn_count == 0) {
00986                         CDEBUG(D_MGC, "log %.8s: disconnecting, won't requeue\n",
00987                                 cld->cld_logname);
00988                         config_log_put(cld);
00989                         break;
00990                 }
00991 
00992                 /* Re-enqueue now */
00993                 mgc_requeue_add(cld);
00994                 config_log_put(cld);
00995                 break;
00996         default:
00997                 LBUG();
00998         }
00999 
01000         RETURN(rc);
01001 }
01002 
01003 /* Not sure where this should go... */
01004 /* This is the timeout value for MGS_CONNECT request plus a ping interval, such
01005  * that we can have a chance to try the secondary MGS if any. */
01006 #define  MGC_ENQUEUE_LIMIT (INITIAL_CONNECT_TIMEOUT + (AT_OFF ? 0 : at_min) \
01007                                 + PING_INTERVAL)
01008 #define  MGC_TARGET_REG_LIMIT 10
01009 #define  MGC_SEND_PARAM_LIMIT 10
01010 
01011 /* Send parameter to MGS*/
01012 static int mgc_set_mgs_param(struct obd_export *exp,
01013                              struct mgs_send_param *msp)
01014 {
01015         struct ptlrpc_request *req;
01016         struct mgs_send_param *req_msp, *rep_msp;
01017         int rc;
01018         ENTRY;
01019 
01020         req = ptlrpc_request_alloc_pack(class_exp2cliimp(exp),
01021                                         &RQF_MGS_SET_INFO, LUSTRE_MGS_VERSION,
01022                                         MGS_SET_INFO);
01023         if (!req)
01024                 RETURN(-ENOMEM);
01025 
01026         req_msp = req_capsule_client_get(&req->rq_pill, &RMF_MGS_SEND_PARAM);
01027         if (!req_msp) {
01028                 ptlrpc_req_finished(req);
01029                 RETURN(-ENOMEM);
01030         }
01031 
01032         memcpy(req_msp, msp, sizeof(*req_msp));
01033         ptlrpc_request_set_replen(req);
01034 
01035         /* Limit how long we will wait for the enqueue to complete */
01036         req->rq_delay_limit = MGC_SEND_PARAM_LIMIT;
01037         rc = ptlrpc_queue_wait(req);
01038         if (!rc) {
01039                 rep_msp = req_capsule_server_get(&req->rq_pill, &RMF_MGS_SEND_PARAM);
01040                 memcpy(msp, rep_msp, sizeof(*rep_msp));
01041         }
01042 
01043         ptlrpc_req_finished(req);
01044 
01045         RETURN(rc);
01046 }
01047 
01048 /* Take a config lock so we can get cancel notifications */
01049 static int mgc_enqueue(struct obd_export *exp, enum ldlm_type type,
01050                        union ldlm_policy_data *policy, enum ldlm_mode mode,
01051                        __u64 *flags, void *bl_cb, void *cp_cb, void *gl_cb,
01052                        void *data, __u32 lvb_len, void *lvb_swabber,
01053                        struct lustre_handle *lockh)
01054 {
01055         struct config_llog_data *cld = (struct config_llog_data *)data;
01056         struct ldlm_enqueue_info einfo = {
01057                 .ei_type        = type,
01058                 .ei_mode        = mode,
01059                 .ei_cb_bl       = mgc_blocking_ast,
01060                 .ei_cb_cp       = ldlm_completion_ast,
01061         };
01062         struct ptlrpc_request *req;
01063         int short_limit = cld_is_sptlrpc(cld);
01064         int rc;
01065         ENTRY;
01066 
01067         CDEBUG(D_MGC, "Enqueue for %s (res "LPX64")\n", cld->cld_logname,
01068                cld->cld_resid.name[0]);
01069 
01070         /* We need a callback for every lockholder, so don't try to
01071            ldlm_lock_match (see rev 1.1.2.11.2.47) */
01072         req = ptlrpc_request_alloc_pack(class_exp2cliimp(exp),
01073                                         &RQF_LDLM_ENQUEUE, LUSTRE_DLM_VERSION,
01074                                         LDLM_ENQUEUE);
01075         if (req == NULL)
01076                 RETURN(-ENOMEM);
01077 
01078         req_capsule_set_size(&req->rq_pill, &RMF_DLM_LVB, RCL_SERVER, 0);
01079         ptlrpc_request_set_replen(req);
01080 
01081         /* check if this is server or client */
01082         if (cld->cld_cfg.cfg_sb) {
01083                 struct lustre_sb_info *lsi = s2lsi(cld->cld_cfg.cfg_sb);
01084                 if (lsi && IS_SERVER(lsi))
01085                         short_limit = 1;
01086         }
01087         /* Limit how long we will wait for the enqueue to complete */
01088         req->rq_delay_limit = short_limit ? 5 : MGC_ENQUEUE_LIMIT;
01089         rc = ldlm_cli_enqueue(exp, &req, &einfo, &cld->cld_resid, NULL, flags,
01090                               NULL, 0, LVB_T_NONE, lockh, 0);
01091         /* A failed enqueue should still call the mgc_blocking_ast,
01092            where it will be requeued if needed ("grant failed"). */
01093         ptlrpc_req_finished(req);
01094         RETURN(rc);
01095 }
01096 
01097 static int mgc_cancel(struct obd_export *exp, enum ldlm_mode mode,
01098                       struct lustre_handle *lockh)
01099 {
01100         ENTRY;
01101 
01102         ldlm_lock_decref(lockh, mode);
01103 
01104         RETURN(0);
01105 }
01106 
01107 static void mgc_notify_active(struct obd_device *unused)
01108 {
01109         /* wakeup mgc_requeue_thread to requeue mgc lock */
01110         spin_lock(&config_list_lock);
01111         rq_state |= RQ_NOW;
01112         spin_unlock(&config_list_lock);
01113         wake_up(&rq_waitq);
01114 
01115         /* TODO: Help the MGS rebuild nidtbl. -jay */
01116 }
01117 
01118 /* Send target_reg message to MGS */
01119 static int mgc_target_register(struct obd_export *exp,
01120                                struct mgs_target_info *mti)
01121 {
01122         struct ptlrpc_request  *req;
01123         struct mgs_target_info *req_mti, *rep_mti;
01124         int                     rc;
01125         ENTRY;
01126 
01127         req = ptlrpc_request_alloc_pack(class_exp2cliimp(exp),
01128                                         &RQF_MGS_TARGET_REG, LUSTRE_MGS_VERSION,
01129                                         MGS_TARGET_REG);
01130         if (req == NULL)
01131                 RETURN(-ENOMEM);
01132 
01133         req_mti = req_capsule_client_get(&req->rq_pill, &RMF_MGS_TARGET_INFO);
01134         if (!req_mti) {
01135                 ptlrpc_req_finished(req);
01136                 RETURN(-ENOMEM);
01137         }
01138 
01139         memcpy(req_mti, mti, sizeof(*req_mti));
01140         ptlrpc_request_set_replen(req);
01141         CDEBUG(D_MGC, "register %s\n", mti->mti_svname);
01142         /* Limit how long we will wait for the enqueue to complete */
01143         req->rq_delay_limit = MGC_TARGET_REG_LIMIT;
01144 
01145         rc = ptlrpc_queue_wait(req);
01146         if (!rc) {
01147                 rep_mti = req_capsule_server_get(&req->rq_pill,
01148                                                  &RMF_MGS_TARGET_INFO);
01149                 memcpy(mti, rep_mti, sizeof(*rep_mti));
01150                 CDEBUG(D_MGC, "register %s got index = %d\n",
01151                        mti->mti_svname, mti->mti_stripe_index);
01152         }
01153         ptlrpc_req_finished(req);
01154 
01155         RETURN(rc);
01156 }
01157 
01158 static int mgc_set_info_async(const struct lu_env *env, struct obd_export *exp,
01159                               u32 keylen, void *key,
01160                               u32 vallen, void *val,
01161                               struct ptlrpc_request_set *set)
01162 {
01163         int rc = -EINVAL;
01164         ENTRY;
01165 
01166         /* Turn off initial_recov after we try all backup servers once */
01167         if (KEY_IS(KEY_INIT_RECOV_BACKUP)) {
01168                 struct obd_import *imp = class_exp2cliimp(exp);
01169                 int value;
01170                 if (vallen != sizeof(int))
01171                         RETURN(-EINVAL);
01172                 value = *(int *)val;
01173                 CDEBUG(D_MGC, "InitRecov %s %d/d%d:i%d:r%d:or%d:%s\n",
01174                        imp->imp_obd->obd_name, value,
01175                        imp->imp_deactive, imp->imp_invalid,
01176                        imp->imp_replayable, imp->imp_obd->obd_replayable,
01177                        ptlrpc_import_state_name(imp->imp_state));
01178                 /* Resurrect if we previously died */
01179                 if ((imp->imp_state != LUSTRE_IMP_FULL &&
01180                      imp->imp_state != LUSTRE_IMP_NEW) || value > 1)
01181                         ptlrpc_reconnect_import(imp);
01182                 RETURN(0);
01183         }
01184         /* FIXME move this to mgc_process_config */
01185         if (KEY_IS(KEY_REGISTER_TARGET)) {
01186                 struct mgs_target_info *mti;
01187                 if (vallen != sizeof(struct mgs_target_info))
01188                         RETURN(-EINVAL);
01189                 mti = (struct mgs_target_info *)val;
01190                 CDEBUG(D_MGC, "register_target %s %#x\n",
01191                        mti->mti_svname, mti->mti_flags);
01192                 rc =  mgc_target_register(exp, mti);
01193                 RETURN(rc);
01194         }
01195         if (KEY_IS(KEY_SET_FS)) {
01196                 struct super_block *sb = (struct super_block *)val;
01197 
01198                 if (vallen != sizeof(struct super_block))
01199                         RETURN(-EINVAL);
01200 
01201                 rc = mgc_fs_setup(env, exp->exp_obd, sb);
01202                 RETURN(rc);
01203         }
01204         if (KEY_IS(KEY_CLEAR_FS)) {
01205                 if (vallen != 0)
01206                         RETURN(-EINVAL);
01207                 rc = mgc_fs_cleanup(env, exp->exp_obd);
01208                 RETURN(rc);
01209         }
01210         if (KEY_IS(KEY_SET_INFO)) {
01211                 struct mgs_send_param *msp;
01212 
01213                 msp = (struct mgs_send_param *)val;
01214                 rc =  mgc_set_mgs_param(exp, msp);
01215                 RETURN(rc);
01216         }
01217         if (KEY_IS(KEY_MGSSEC)) {
01218                 struct client_obd     *cli = &exp->exp_obd->u.cli;
01219                 struct sptlrpc_flavor  flvr;
01220 
01221                 /*
01222                  * empty string means using current flavor, if which haven't
01223                  * been set yet, set it as null.
01224                  *
01225                  * if flavor has been set previously, check the asking flavor
01226                  * must match the existing one.
01227                  */
01228                 if (vallen == 0) {
01229                         if (cli->cl_flvr_mgc.sf_rpc != SPTLRPC_FLVR_INVALID)
01230                                 RETURN(0);
01231                         val = "null";
01232                         vallen = 4;
01233                 }
01234 
01235                 rc = sptlrpc_parse_flavor(val, &flvr);
01236                 if (rc) {
01237                         CERROR("invalid sptlrpc flavor %s to MGS\n",
01238                                (char *) val);
01239                         RETURN(rc);
01240                 }
01241 
01242                 /*
01243                  * caller already hold a mutex
01244                  */
01245                 if (cli->cl_flvr_mgc.sf_rpc == SPTLRPC_FLVR_INVALID) {
01246                         cli->cl_flvr_mgc = flvr;
01247                 } else if (memcmp(&cli->cl_flvr_mgc, &flvr,
01248                                   sizeof(flvr)) != 0) {
01249                         char    str[20];
01250 
01251                         sptlrpc_flavor2name(&cli->cl_flvr_mgc,
01252                                             str, sizeof(str));
01253                         LCONSOLE_ERROR("asking sptlrpc flavor %s to MGS but "
01254                                        "currently %s is in use\n",
01255                                        (char *) val, str);
01256                         rc = -EPERM;
01257                 }
01258                 RETURN(rc);
01259         }
01260 
01261         RETURN(rc);
01262 }
01263 
01264 static int mgc_get_info(const struct lu_env *env, struct obd_export *exp,
01265                         __u32 keylen, void *key, __u32 *vallen, void *val)
01266 {
01267         int rc = -EINVAL;
01268 
01269         if (KEY_IS(KEY_CONN_DATA)) {
01270                 struct obd_import *imp = class_exp2cliimp(exp);
01271                 struct obd_connect_data *data = val;
01272 
01273                 if (*vallen == sizeof(*data)) {
01274                         *data = imp->imp_connect_data;
01275                         rc = 0;
01276                 }
01277         }
01278 
01279         return rc;
01280 }
01281 
01282 static int mgc_import_event(struct obd_device *obd,
01283                             struct obd_import *imp,
01284                             enum obd_import_event event)
01285 {
01286         int rc = 0;
01287 
01288         LASSERT(imp->imp_obd == obd);
01289         CDEBUG(D_MGC, "import event %#x\n", event);
01290 
01291         switch (event) {
01292         case IMP_EVENT_DISCON:
01293                 /* MGC imports should not wait for recovery */
01294                 if (OCD_HAS_FLAG(&imp->imp_connect_data, IMP_RECOV))
01295                         ptlrpc_pinger_ir_down();
01296                 break;
01297         case IMP_EVENT_INACTIVE:
01298                 break;
01299         case IMP_EVENT_INVALIDATE: {
01300                 struct ldlm_namespace *ns = obd->obd_namespace;
01301                 ldlm_namespace_cleanup(ns, LDLM_FL_LOCAL_ONLY);
01302                 break;
01303         }
01304         case IMP_EVENT_ACTIVE:
01305                 CDEBUG(D_INFO, "%s: Reactivating import\n", obd->obd_name);
01306                 /* Clearing obd_no_recov allows us to continue pinging */
01307                 obd->obd_no_recov = 0;
01308                 mgc_notify_active(obd);
01309                 if (OCD_HAS_FLAG(&imp->imp_connect_data, IMP_RECOV))
01310                         ptlrpc_pinger_ir_up();
01311                 break;
01312         case IMP_EVENT_OCD:
01313                 break;
01314         case IMP_EVENT_DEACTIVATE:
01315         case IMP_EVENT_ACTIVATE:
01316                 break;
01317         default:
01318                 CERROR("Unknown import event %#x\n", event);
01319                 LBUG();
01320         }
01321         RETURN(rc);
01322 }
01323 
01324 enum {
01325         CONFIG_READ_NRPAGES_INIT = 1 << (20 - PAGE_CACHE_SHIFT),
01326         CONFIG_READ_NRPAGES      = 4
01327 };
01328 
01329 static int mgc_apply_recover_logs(struct obd_device *mgc,
01330                                   struct config_llog_data *cld,
01331                                   __u64 max_version,
01332                                   void *data, int datalen, bool mne_swab)
01333 {
01334         struct config_llog_instance *cfg = &cld->cld_cfg;
01335         struct lustre_sb_info       *lsi = s2lsi(cfg->cfg_sb);
01336         struct mgs_nidtbl_entry *entry;
01337         struct lustre_cfg       *lcfg;
01338         struct lustre_cfg_bufs   bufs;
01339         u64   prev_version = 0;
01340         char *inst;
01341         char *buf;
01342         int   bufsz;
01343         int   pos;
01344         int   rc  = 0;
01345         int   off = 0;
01346         ENTRY;
01347 
01348         LASSERT(cfg->cfg_instance != NULL);
01349         LASSERT(cfg->cfg_sb == cfg->cfg_instance);
01350 
01351         OBD_ALLOC(inst, PAGE_CACHE_SIZE);
01352         if (inst == NULL)
01353                 RETURN(-ENOMEM);
01354 
01355         if (!IS_SERVER(lsi)) {
01356                 pos = snprintf(inst, PAGE_CACHE_SIZE, "%p", cfg->cfg_instance);
01357                 if (pos >= PAGE_CACHE_SIZE) {
01358                         OBD_FREE(inst, PAGE_CACHE_SIZE);
01359                         return -E2BIG;
01360                 }
01361         } else {
01362                 LASSERT(IS_MDT(lsi));
01363                 rc = server_name2svname(lsi->lsi_svname, inst, NULL,
01364                                         PAGE_CACHE_SIZE);
01365                 if (rc) {
01366                         OBD_FREE(inst, PAGE_CACHE_SIZE);
01367                         RETURN(-EINVAL);
01368                 }
01369                 pos = strlen(inst);
01370         }
01371 
01372         ++pos;
01373         buf   = inst + pos;
01374         bufsz = PAGE_CACHE_SIZE - pos;
01375 
01376         while (datalen > 0) {
01377                 int   entry_len = sizeof(*entry);
01378                 int   is_ost, i;
01379                 struct obd_device *obd;
01380                 char *obdname;
01381                 char *cname;
01382                 char *params;
01383                 char *uuid;
01384 
01385                 rc = -EINVAL;
01386                 if (datalen < sizeof(*entry))
01387                         break;
01388 
01389                 entry = (typeof(entry))(data + off);
01390 
01391                 /* sanity check */
01392                 if (entry->mne_nid_type != 0) /* only support type 0 for ipv4 */
01393                         break;
01394                 if (entry->mne_nid_count == 0) /* at least one nid entry */
01395                         break;
01396                 if (entry->mne_nid_size != sizeof(lnet_nid_t))
01397                         break;
01398 
01399                 entry_len += entry->mne_nid_count * entry->mne_nid_size;
01400                 if (datalen < entry_len) /* must have entry_len at least */
01401                         break;
01402 
01403                 /* Keep this swab for normal mixed endian handling. LU-1644 */
01404                 if (mne_swab)
01405                         lustre_swab_mgs_nidtbl_entry(entry);
01406                 if (entry->mne_length > PAGE_CACHE_SIZE) {
01407                         CERROR("MNE too large (%u)\n", entry->mne_length);
01408                         break;
01409                 }
01410 
01411                 if (entry->mne_length < entry_len)
01412                         break;
01413 
01414                 off     += entry->mne_length;
01415                 datalen -= entry->mne_length;
01416                 if (datalen < 0)
01417                         break;
01418 
01419                 if (entry->mne_version > max_version) {
01420                         CERROR("entry index(%lld) is over max_index(%lld)\n",
01421                                entry->mne_version, max_version);
01422                         break;
01423                 }
01424 
01425                 if (prev_version >= entry->mne_version) {
01426                         CERROR("index unsorted, prev %lld, now %lld\n",
01427                                prev_version, entry->mne_version);
01428                         break;
01429                 }
01430                 prev_version = entry->mne_version;
01431 
01432                 /*
01433                  * Write a string with format "nid::instance" to
01434                  * lustre/<osc|mdc>/<target>-<osc|mdc>-<instance>/import.
01435                  */
01436 
01437                 is_ost = entry->mne_type == LDD_F_SV_TYPE_OST;
01438                 memset(buf, 0, bufsz);
01439                 obdname = buf;
01440                 pos = 0;
01441 
01442                 /* lustre-OST0001-osc-<instance #> */
01443                 strcpy(obdname, cld->cld_logname);
01444                 cname = strrchr(obdname, '-');
01445                 if (cname == NULL) {
01446                         CERROR("mgc %s: invalid logname %s\n",
01447                                mgc->obd_name, obdname);
01448                         break;
01449                 }
01450 
01451                 pos = cname - obdname;
01452                 obdname[pos] = 0;
01453                 pos += sprintf(obdname + pos, "-%s%04x",
01454                                   is_ost ? "OST" : "MDT", entry->mne_index);
01455 
01456                 cname = is_ost ? "osc" : "mdc",
01457                 pos += sprintf(obdname + pos, "-%s-%s", cname, inst);
01458                 lustre_cfg_bufs_reset(&bufs, obdname);
01459 
01460                 /* find the obd by obdname */
01461                 obd = class_name2obd(obdname);
01462                 if (obd == NULL) {
01463                         CDEBUG(D_INFO, "mgc %s: cannot find obdname %s\n",
01464                                mgc->obd_name, obdname);
01465                         rc = 0;
01466                         /* this is a safe race, when the ost is starting up...*/
01467                         continue;
01468                 }
01469 
01470                 /* osc.import = "connection=<Conn UUID>::<target instance>" */
01471                 ++pos;
01472                 params = buf + pos;
01473                 pos += sprintf(params, "%s.import=%s", cname, "connection=");
01474                 uuid = buf + pos;
01475 
01476                 down_read(&obd->u.cli.cl_sem);
01477                 if (obd->u.cli.cl_import == NULL) {
01478                         /* client does not connect to the OST yet */
01479                         up_read(&obd->u.cli.cl_sem);
01480                         rc = 0;
01481                         continue;
01482                 }
01483 
01484                 /* iterate all nids to find one */
01485                 /* find uuid by nid */
01486                 rc = -ENOENT;
01487                 for (i = 0; i < entry->mne_nid_count; i++) {
01488                         rc = client_import_find_conn(obd->u.cli.cl_import,
01489                                                      entry->u.nids[i],
01490                                                      (struct obd_uuid *)uuid);
01491                         if (rc == 0)
01492                                 break;
01493                 }
01494 
01495                 up_read(&obd->u.cli.cl_sem);
01496                 if (rc < 0) {
01497                         CERROR("mgc: cannot find uuid by nid %s\n",
01498                                libcfs_nid2str(entry->u.nids[0]));
01499                         break;
01500                 }
01501 
01502                 CDEBUG(D_INFO, "Find uuid %s by nid %s\n",
01503                        uuid, libcfs_nid2str(entry->u.nids[0]));
01504 
01505                 pos += strlen(uuid);
01506                 pos += sprintf(buf + pos, "::%u", entry->mne_instance);
01507                 LASSERT(pos < bufsz);
01508 
01509                 lustre_cfg_bufs_set_string(&bufs, 1, params);
01510 
01511                 lcfg = lustre_cfg_new(LCFG_PARAM, &bufs);
01512                 if (lcfg == NULL) {
01513                         rc = -ENOMEM;
01514                         break;
01515                 }
01516 
01517                 CDEBUG(D_INFO, "ir apply logs "LPD64"/"LPD64" for %s -> %s\n",
01518                        prev_version, max_version, obdname, params);
01519 
01520                 rc = class_process_config(lcfg);
01521                 lustre_cfg_free(lcfg);
01522                 if (rc)
01523                         CDEBUG(D_INFO, "process config for %s error %d\n",
01524                                obdname, rc);
01525 
01526                 /* continue, even one with error */
01527         }
01528 
01529         OBD_FREE(inst, PAGE_CACHE_SIZE);
01530         RETURN(rc);
01531 }
01532 
01537 static int mgc_process_recover_log(struct obd_device *obd,
01538                                    struct config_llog_data *cld)
01539 {
01540         struct ptlrpc_request *req = NULL;
01541         struct config_llog_instance *cfg = &cld->cld_cfg;
01542         struct mgs_config_body *body;
01543         struct mgs_config_res  *res;
01544         struct ptlrpc_bulk_desc *desc;
01545         struct page **pages;
01546         int nrpages;
01547         bool eof = true;
01548         bool mne_swab = false;
01549         int i;
01550         int ealen;
01551         int rc;
01552         ENTRY;
01553 
01554         /* allocate buffer for bulk transfer.
01555          * if this is the first time for this mgs to read logs,
01556          * CONFIG_READ_NRPAGES_INIT will be used since it will read all logs
01557          * once; otherwise, it only reads increment of logs, this should be
01558          * small and CONFIG_READ_NRPAGES will be used.
01559          */
01560         nrpages = CONFIG_READ_NRPAGES;
01561         if (cfg->cfg_last_idx == 0) /* the first time */
01562                 nrpages = CONFIG_READ_NRPAGES_INIT;
01563 
01564         OBD_ALLOC(pages, sizeof(*pages) * nrpages);
01565         if (pages == NULL)
01566                 GOTO(out, rc = -ENOMEM);
01567 
01568         for (i = 0; i < nrpages; i++) {
01569                 pages[i] = alloc_page(GFP_KERNEL);
01570                 if (pages[i] == NULL)
01571                         GOTO(out, rc = -ENOMEM);
01572         }
01573 
01574 again:
01575         LASSERT(cld_is_recover(cld));
01576         LASSERT(mutex_is_locked(&cld->cld_lock));
01577         req = ptlrpc_request_alloc(class_exp2cliimp(cld->cld_mgcexp),
01578                                    &RQF_MGS_CONFIG_READ);
01579         if (req == NULL)
01580                 GOTO(out, rc = -ENOMEM);
01581 
01582         rc = ptlrpc_request_pack(req, LUSTRE_MGS_VERSION, MGS_CONFIG_READ);
01583         if (rc)
01584                 GOTO(out, rc);
01585 
01586         /* pack request */
01587         body = req_capsule_client_get(&req->rq_pill, &RMF_MGS_CONFIG_BODY);
01588         LASSERT(body != NULL);
01589         LASSERT(sizeof(body->mcb_name) > strlen(cld->cld_logname));
01590         if (strlcpy(body->mcb_name, cld->cld_logname, sizeof(body->mcb_name))
01591             >= sizeof(body->mcb_name))
01592                 GOTO(out, rc = -E2BIG);
01593         body->mcb_offset = cfg->cfg_last_idx + 1;
01594         body->mcb_type   = cld->cld_type;
01595         body->mcb_bits   = PAGE_CACHE_SHIFT;
01596         body->mcb_units  = nrpages;
01597 
01598         /* allocate bulk transfer descriptor */
01599         desc = ptlrpc_prep_bulk_imp(req, nrpages, 1,
01600                                     PTLRPC_BULK_PUT_SINK | PTLRPC_BULK_BUF_KIOV,
01601                                     MGS_BULK_PORTAL,
01602                                     &ptlrpc_bulk_kiov_pin_ops);
01603         if (desc == NULL)
01604                 GOTO(out, rc = -ENOMEM);
01605 
01606         for (i = 0; i < nrpages; i++)
01607                 desc->bd_frag_ops->add_kiov_frag(desc, pages[i], 0,
01608                                                  PAGE_CACHE_SIZE);
01609 
01610         ptlrpc_request_set_replen(req);
01611         rc = ptlrpc_queue_wait(req);
01612         if (rc)
01613                 GOTO(out, rc);
01614 
01615         res = req_capsule_server_get(&req->rq_pill, &RMF_MGS_CONFIG_RES);
01616         if (res->mcr_size < res->mcr_offset)
01617                 GOTO(out, rc = -EINVAL);
01618 
01619         /* always update the index even though it might have errors with
01620          * handling the recover logs */
01621         cfg->cfg_last_idx = res->mcr_offset;
01622         eof = res->mcr_offset == res->mcr_size;
01623 
01624         CDEBUG(D_INFO, "Latest version "LPD64", more %d.\n",
01625                res->mcr_offset, eof == false);
01626 
01627         ealen = sptlrpc_cli_unwrap_bulk_read(req, req->rq_bulk, 0);
01628         if (ealen < 0)
01629                 GOTO(out, rc = ealen);
01630 
01631         if (ealen > nrpages << PAGE_CACHE_SHIFT)
01632                 GOTO(out, rc = -EINVAL);
01633 
01634         if (ealen == 0) { /* no logs transferred */
01635                 if (!eof)
01636                         rc = -EINVAL;
01637                 GOTO(out, rc);
01638         }
01639 
01640         mne_swab = !!ptlrpc_rep_need_swab(req);
01641 #if LUSTRE_VERSION_CODE < OBD_OCD_VERSION(3, 0, 53, 0)
01642         /* This import flag means the server did an extra swab of IR MNE
01643          * records (fixed in LU-1252), reverse it here if needed. LU-1644 */
01644         if (unlikely(req->rq_import->imp_need_mne_swab))
01645                 mne_swab = !mne_swab;
01646 #endif
01647 
01648         for (i = 0; i < nrpages && ealen > 0; i++) {
01649                 int rc2;
01650                 void *ptr;
01651 
01652                 ptr = kmap(pages[i]);
01653                 rc2 = mgc_apply_recover_logs(obd, cld, res->mcr_offset, ptr,
01654                                              min_t(int, ealen, PAGE_CACHE_SIZE),
01655                                              mne_swab);
01656                 kunmap(pages[i]);
01657                 if (rc2 < 0) {
01658                         CWARN("Process recover log %s error %d\n",
01659                               cld->cld_logname, rc2);
01660                         break;
01661                 }
01662 
01663                 ealen -= PAGE_CACHE_SIZE;
01664         }
01665 
01666 out:
01667         if (req)
01668                 ptlrpc_req_finished(req);
01669 
01670         if (rc == 0 && !eof)
01671                 goto again;
01672 
01673         if (pages) {
01674                 for (i = 0; i < nrpages; i++) {
01675                         if (pages[i] == NULL)
01676                                 break;
01677                         __free_page(pages[i]);
01678                 }
01679                 OBD_FREE(pages, sizeof(*pages) * nrpages);
01680         }
01681         return rc;
01682 }
01683 
01684 /* Copy a remote log locally */
01685 static int mgc_llog_local_copy(const struct lu_env *env,
01686                                struct obd_device *obd,
01687                                struct llog_ctxt *rctxt,
01688                                struct llog_ctxt *lctxt, char *logname)
01689 {
01690         char    *temp_log;
01691         int      rc;
01692 
01693         ENTRY;
01694 
01695         /*
01696          * - copy it to backup using llog_backup()
01697          * - copy remote llog to logname using llog_backup()
01698          * - if failed then move bakup to logname again
01699          */
01700 
01701         OBD_ALLOC(temp_log, strlen(logname) + 2);
01702         if (!temp_log)
01703                 RETURN(-ENOMEM);
01704         sprintf(temp_log, "%sT", logname);
01705 
01706         /* make a copy of local llog at first */
01707         rc = llog_backup(env, obd, lctxt, lctxt, logname, temp_log);
01708         if (rc < 0 && rc != -ENOENT)
01709                 GOTO(out, rc);
01710         /* copy remote llog to the local copy */
01711         rc = llog_backup(env, obd, rctxt, lctxt, logname, logname);
01712         if (rc == -ENOENT) {
01713                 /* no remote llog, delete local one too */
01714                 llog_erase(env, lctxt, NULL, logname);
01715         } else if (rc < 0) {
01716                 /* error during backup, get local one back from the copy */
01717                 llog_backup(env, obd, lctxt, lctxt, temp_log, logname);
01718 out:
01719                 CERROR("%s: failed to copy remote log %s: rc = %d\n",
01720                        obd->obd_name, logname, rc);
01721         }
01722         llog_erase(env, lctxt, NULL, temp_log);
01723         OBD_FREE(temp_log, strlen(logname) + 2);
01724         return rc;
01725 }
01726 
01727 /* local_only means it cannot get remote llogs */
01728 static int mgc_process_cfg_log(struct obd_device *mgc,
01729                                struct config_llog_data *cld, int local_only)
01730 {
01731         struct llog_ctxt        *ctxt, *lctxt = NULL;
01732         struct client_obd       *cli = &mgc->u.cli;
01733         struct lustre_sb_info   *lsi = NULL;
01734         int                      rc = 0;
01735         bool                     sptlrpc_started = false;
01736         struct lu_env           *env;
01737 
01738         ENTRY;
01739 
01740         LASSERT(cld);
01741         LASSERT(mutex_is_locked(&cld->cld_lock));
01742 
01743         /*
01744          * local copy of sptlrpc log is controlled elsewhere, don't try to
01745          * read it up here.
01746          */
01747         if (cld_is_sptlrpc(cld) && local_only)
01748                 RETURN(0);
01749 
01750         if (cld->cld_cfg.cfg_sb)
01751                 lsi = s2lsi(cld->cld_cfg.cfg_sb);
01752 
01753         OBD_ALLOC_PTR(env);
01754         if (env == NULL)
01755                 RETURN(-ENOMEM);
01756 
01757         rc = lu_env_init(env, LCT_MG_THREAD);
01758         if (rc)
01759                 GOTO(out_free, rc);
01760 
01761         ctxt = llog_get_context(mgc, LLOG_CONFIG_REPL_CTXT);
01762         LASSERT(ctxt);
01763 
01764         lctxt = llog_get_context(mgc, LLOG_CONFIG_ORIG_CTXT);
01765 
01766         /* Copy the setup log locally if we can. Don't mess around if we're
01767          * running an MGS though (logs are already local). */
01768         if (lctxt && lsi && IS_SERVER(lsi) && !IS_MGS(lsi) &&
01769             cli->cl_mgc_configs_dir != NULL &&
01770             lu2dt_dev(cli->cl_mgc_configs_dir->do_lu.lo_dev) ==
01771             lsi->lsi_dt_dev) {
01772                 if (!local_only)
01773                         /* Only try to copy log if we have the lock. */
01774                         rc = mgc_llog_local_copy(env, mgc, ctxt, lctxt,
01775                                                  cld->cld_logname);
01776                 if (local_only || rc) {
01777                         if (strcmp(cld->cld_logname, PARAMS_FILENAME) != 0 &&
01778                             llog_is_empty(env, lctxt, cld->cld_logname)) {
01779                                 LCONSOLE_ERROR_MSG(0x13a, "Failed to get MGS "
01780                                                    "log %s and no local copy."
01781                                                    "\n", cld->cld_logname);
01782                                 GOTO(out_pop, rc = -ENOENT);
01783                         }
01784                         CDEBUG(D_MGC, "Failed to get MGS log %s, using local "
01785                                "copy for now, will try to update later.\n",
01786                                cld->cld_logname);
01787                         rc = 0;
01788                 }
01789                 /* Now, whether we copied or not, start using the local llog.
01790                  * If we failed to copy, we'll start using whatever the old
01791                  * log has. */
01792                 llog_ctxt_put(ctxt);
01793                 ctxt = lctxt;
01794                 lctxt = NULL;
01795         } else {
01796                 if (local_only) /* no local log at client side */
01797                         GOTO(out_pop, rc = -EIO);
01798         }
01799 
01800         if (cld_is_sptlrpc(cld)) {
01801                 sptlrpc_conf_log_update_begin(cld->cld_logname);
01802                 sptlrpc_started = true;
01803         }
01804 
01805         /* logname and instance info should be the same, so use our
01806          * copy of the instance for the update.  The cfg_last_idx will
01807          * be updated here. */
01808         rc = class_config_parse_llog(env, ctxt, cld->cld_logname,
01809                                      &cld->cld_cfg);
01810         EXIT;
01811 
01812 out_pop:
01813         __llog_ctxt_put(env, ctxt);
01814         if (lctxt)
01815                 __llog_ctxt_put(env, lctxt);
01816 
01817         /*
01818          * update settings on existing OBDs. doing it inside
01819          * of llog_process_lock so no device is attaching/detaching
01820          * in parallel.
01821          * the logname must be <fsname>-sptlrpc
01822          */
01823         if (sptlrpc_started) {
01824                 LASSERT(cld_is_sptlrpc(cld));
01825                 sptlrpc_conf_log_update_end(cld->cld_logname);
01826                 class_notify_sptlrpc_conf(cld->cld_logname,
01827                                           strlen(cld->cld_logname) -
01828                                           strlen("-sptlrpc"));
01829         }
01830 
01831         lu_env_fini(env);
01832 out_free:
01833         OBD_FREE_PTR(env);
01834         return rc;
01835 }
01836 
01837 static bool mgc_import_in_recovery(struct obd_import *imp)
01838 {
01839         bool in_recovery = true;
01840 
01841         spin_lock(&imp->imp_lock);
01842         if (imp->imp_state == LUSTRE_IMP_FULL ||
01843             imp->imp_state == LUSTRE_IMP_CLOSED)
01844                 in_recovery = false;
01845         spin_unlock(&imp->imp_lock);
01846 
01847         return in_recovery;
01848 }
01849 
01878 int mgc_process_log(struct obd_device *mgc, struct config_llog_data *cld)
01879 {
01880         struct lustre_handle lockh = { 0 };
01881         __u64 flags = LDLM_FL_NO_LRU;
01882         int rc = 0, rcl;
01883         bool retry = false;
01884         ENTRY;
01885 
01886         LASSERT(cld != NULL);
01887 
01888         /* I don't want multiple processes running process_log at once --
01889            sounds like badness.  It actually might be fine, as long as
01890            we're not trying to update from the same log
01891            simultaneously (in which case we should use a per-log sem.) */
01892 restart:
01893         mutex_lock(&cld->cld_lock);
01894         if (cld->cld_stopping) {
01895                 mutex_unlock(&cld->cld_lock);
01896                 RETURN(0);
01897         }
01898 
01899         OBD_FAIL_TIMEOUT(OBD_FAIL_MGC_PAUSE_PROCESS_LOG, 20);
01900 
01901         CDEBUG(D_MGC, "Process log %s:%p from %d\n", cld->cld_logname,
01902                cld->cld_cfg.cfg_instance, cld->cld_cfg.cfg_last_idx + 1);
01903 
01904         /* Get the cfg lock on the llog */
01905         rcl = mgc_enqueue(mgc->u.cli.cl_mgc_mgsexp, LDLM_PLAIN, NULL,
01906                           LCK_CR, &flags, NULL, NULL, NULL,
01907                           cld, 0, NULL, &lockh);
01908         if (rcl == 0) {
01909                 /* Get the cld, it will be released in mgc_blocking_ast. */
01910                 config_log_get(cld);
01911                 rc = ldlm_lock_set_data(&lockh, (void *)cld);
01912                 LASSERT(rc == 0);
01913         } else {
01914                 CDEBUG(D_MGC, "Can't get cfg lock: %d\n", rcl);
01915 
01916                 if (rcl == -ESHUTDOWN &&
01917                     atomic_read(&mgc->u.cli.cl_mgc_refcount) > 0 && !retry) {
01918                         struct obd_import *imp;
01919                         struct l_wait_info lwi;
01920                         int secs = cfs_time_seconds(obd_timeout);
01921 
01922                         mutex_unlock(&cld->cld_lock);
01923                         imp = class_exp2cliimp(mgc->u.cli.cl_mgc_mgsexp);
01924 
01925                         /* Let's force the pinger, and wait the import to be
01926                          * connected, note: since mgc import is non-replayable,
01927                          * and even the import state is disconnected, it does
01928                          * not mean the "recovery" is stopped, so we will keep
01929                          * waitting until timeout or the import state is
01930                          * FULL or closed */
01931                         ptlrpc_pinger_force(imp);
01932 
01933                         lwi = LWI_TIMEOUT(secs, NULL, NULL);
01934                         l_wait_event(imp->imp_recovery_waitq,
01935                                      !mgc_import_in_recovery(imp), &lwi);
01936 
01937                         if (imp->imp_state == LUSTRE_IMP_FULL) {
01938                                 retry = true;
01939                                 goto restart;
01940                         } else {
01941                                 mutex_lock(&cld->cld_lock);
01942                                 cld->cld_lostlock = 1;
01943                         }
01944                 } else {
01945                         /* mark cld_lostlock so that it will requeue
01946                          * after MGC becomes available. */
01947                         cld->cld_lostlock = 1;
01948                 }
01949                 /* Get extra reference, it will be put in requeue thread */
01950                 config_log_get(cld);
01951         }
01952 
01953 
01954         if (cld_is_recover(cld)) {
01955                 rc = 0; /* this is not a fatal error for recover log */
01956                 if (rcl == 0) {
01957                         rc = mgc_process_recover_log(mgc, cld);
01958                         if (rc != 0) {
01959                                 CERROR("%s: recover log %s failed: rc = %d"
01960                                        "not fatal.\n", mgc->obd_name,
01961                                        cld->cld_logname, rc);
01962                                 rc = 0;
01963                                 cld->cld_lostlock = 1;
01964                         }
01965                 }
01966         } else {
01967                 rc = mgc_process_cfg_log(mgc, cld, rcl != 0);
01968         }
01969 
01970         CDEBUG(D_MGC, "%s: configuration from log '%s' %sed (%d).\n",
01971                mgc->obd_name, cld->cld_logname, rc ? "fail" : "succeed", rc);
01972 
01973         mutex_unlock(&cld->cld_lock);
01974 
01975         /* Now drop the lock so MGS can revoke it */
01976         if (!rcl) {
01977                 rcl = mgc_cancel(mgc->u.cli.cl_mgc_mgsexp, LCK_CR, &lockh);
01978                 if (rcl)
01979                         CERROR("Can't drop cfg lock: %d\n", rcl);
01980         }
01981 
01982         RETURN(rc);
01983 }
01984 
01985 
01990 static int mgc_process_config(struct obd_device *obd, size_t len, void *buf)
01991 {
01992         struct lustre_cfg *lcfg = buf;
01993         struct config_llog_instance *cfg = NULL;
01994         char *logname;
01995         int rc = 0;
01996         ENTRY;
01997 
01998         switch(lcfg->lcfg_command) {
01999         case LCFG_LOV_ADD_OBD: {
02000                 /* Overloading this cfg command: register a new target */
02001                 struct mgs_target_info *mti;
02002 
02003                 if (LUSTRE_CFG_BUFLEN(lcfg, 1) !=
02004                     sizeof(struct mgs_target_info))
02005                         GOTO(out, rc = -EINVAL);
02006 
02007                 mti = (struct mgs_target_info *)lustre_cfg_buf(lcfg, 1);
02008                 CDEBUG(D_MGC, "add_target %s %#x\n",
02009                        mti->mti_svname, mti->mti_flags);
02010                 rc = mgc_target_register(obd->u.cli.cl_mgc_mgsexp, mti);
02011                 break;
02012         }
02013         case LCFG_LOV_DEL_OBD:
02014                 /* Unregister has no meaning at the moment. */
02015                 CERROR("lov_del_obd unimplemented\n");
02016                 rc = -ENOSYS;
02017                 break;
02018         case LCFG_SPTLRPC_CONF: {
02019                 rc = sptlrpc_process_config(lcfg);
02020                 break;
02021         }
02022         case LCFG_LOG_START: {
02023                 struct config_llog_data *cld;
02024                 struct super_block *sb;
02025 
02026                 logname = lustre_cfg_string(lcfg, 1);
02027                 cfg = (struct config_llog_instance *)lustre_cfg_buf(lcfg, 2);
02028                 sb = *(struct super_block **)lustre_cfg_buf(lcfg, 3);
02029 
02030                 CDEBUG(D_MGC, "parse_log %s from %d\n", logname,
02031                        cfg->cfg_last_idx);
02032 
02033                 /* We're only called through here on the initial mount */
02034                 rc = config_log_add(obd, logname, cfg, sb);
02035                 if (rc)
02036                         break;
02037                 cld = config_log_find(logname, cfg);
02038                 if (cld == NULL) {
02039                         rc = -ENOENT;
02040                         break;
02041                 }
02042 
02043                 /* COMPAT_146 */
02044                 /* FIXME only set this for old logs!  Right now this forces
02045                    us to always skip the "inside markers" check */
02046                 cld->cld_cfg.cfg_flags |= CFG_F_COMPAT146;
02047 
02048                 rc = mgc_process_log(obd, cld);
02049                 if (rc == 0 && cld->cld_recover != NULL) {
02050                         if (OCD_HAS_FLAG(&obd->u.cli.cl_import->
02051                                          imp_connect_data, IMP_RECOV)) {
02052                                 rc = mgc_process_log(obd, cld->cld_recover);
02053                         } else {
02054                                 struct config_llog_data *cir = cld->cld_recover;
02055                                 cld->cld_recover = NULL;
02056                                 config_log_put(cir);
02057                         }
02058                         if (rc)
02059                                 CERROR("Cannot process recover llog %d\n", rc);
02060                 }
02061 
02062                 if (rc == 0 && cld->cld_params != NULL) {
02063                         rc = mgc_process_log(obd, cld->cld_params);
02064                         if (rc == -ENOENT) {
02065                                 CDEBUG(D_MGC, "There is no params "
02066                                               "config file yet\n");
02067                                 rc = 0;
02068                         }
02069                         /* params log is optional */
02070                         if (rc)
02071                                 CERROR("%s: can't process params llog: rc = %d\n",
02072                                        obd->obd_name, rc);
02073                 }
02074                 config_log_put(cld);
02075 
02076                 break;
02077         }
02078         case LCFG_LOG_END: {
02079                 logname = lustre_cfg_string(lcfg, 1);
02080 
02081                 if (lcfg->lcfg_bufcount >= 2)
02082                         cfg = (struct config_llog_instance *)lustre_cfg_buf(
02083                                 lcfg, 2);
02084                 rc = config_log_end(logname, cfg);
02085                 break;
02086         }
02087         default: {
02088                 CERROR("Unknown command: %d\n", lcfg->lcfg_command);
02089                 GOTO(out, rc = -EINVAL);
02090 
02091         }
02092         }
02093 out:
02094         RETURN(rc);
02095 }
02096 
02097 static struct obd_ops mgc_obd_ops = {
02098         .o_owner        = THIS_MODULE,
02099         .o_setup        = mgc_setup,
02100         .o_precleanup   = mgc_precleanup,
02101         .o_cleanup      = mgc_cleanup,
02102         .o_add_conn     = client_import_add_conn,
02103         .o_del_conn     = client_import_del_conn,
02104         .o_connect      = client_connect_import,
02105         .o_disconnect   = client_disconnect_export,
02106         .o_set_info_async = mgc_set_info_async,
02107         .o_get_info       = mgc_get_info,
02108         .o_import_event = mgc_import_event,
02109         .o_process_config = mgc_process_config,
02110 };
02111 
02112 static int __init mgc_init(void)
02113 {
02114         return class_register_type(&mgc_obd_ops, NULL, true, NULL,
02115                                    LUSTRE_MGC_NAME, NULL);
02116 }
02117 
02118 static void __exit mgc_exit(void)
02119 {
02120         class_unregister_type(LUSTRE_MGC_NAME);
02121 }
